Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign
You may park your vehicle for no longer than 40 minutes from 8am to 6pm on days other than public holidays
You may park your vehicle for longer than 40 minutes if someone stays in it
You may not park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: What must you do when red lights are flashing at a railway level crossing?

Answers.Answer: Drive over the lines as soon as the train has passed
Slow down and then drive over the lines
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Stop and if no train is coming you may drive over the lines

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What are you NOT allowed to do when driving on a motorway?
Which one of the following vehicles can you drive on a car licence?
When turning right from a two-laned road into a one-way street that has two lanes, which lane must you turn into?

Answers.Answer: The lane that has the least vehicles
The lane that gives you the most direct route

Question: If you have a rear tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.
What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?
What is the safest way to carry goods inside a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: On the floor by the driver’s feet
On the shelf near the rear window

Question: When passing a horse and rider, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Warn the rider by sounding the horn on your vehicle
Slow down and give them as much room as you can
Warn the rider by turning your vehicle headlights on

Question: When should you apply the 4-second rule?

Answers.Answer: Never. You should only use the 2-second rule
In wet, frosty or icy road conditions
When waiting for any vehicles coming over a one-way bridge

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Question: When coming up to a roundabout you must give way to all vehicles that will cross your path from your left.
When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: What does this traffic signal mean?

Answers.Answer: Drive on before the signal changes to red
Drive on because the signal will turn green
Stop if you can do so safely
Stop only if traffic is in the way

Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?
What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: To tow a trailer on a restricted driver licence, the weight of your vehicle plus the weight of the trailer and its load must not exceed what weight?
What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: When driving at night, which vehicle lights should you turn on?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may stop your vehicle if there are no buses coming
You may stop your vehicle between 6pm and 8am except on Fridays and Saturdays
You may stop your vehicle if someone stays with it
You may not stop your vehicle at any time

Question: You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

Question: What is the speed limit for vehicles passing a school bus that has stopped to let children on or off?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does it mean if yellow traffic signals are flashing?

Answers.Answer: That a crash has just happened
The traffic signals are not working, apply the give way rules
Vehicles may only proceed straight ahead and not turn
Emergency vehicles are about to come through
